TextBlock.TextLine: En fnvers 3 Juny
Mons michhel cannot
mons. De 8 Du corant J'ay vendu a mons vre fils 3 serges & 30 p de
toilles de cottons, selon la facteur lay donne portant Æ’319:1ost
ua fout pacte ensemble dans un ballote M1 envoyer a Brussel
a mad Deros aucod ordre de le vous envoyer avec le wanier, hier ie
trouue loccasion detirrer sur vre grace, ce que jay fairt dans mo
lettre a trois j ours dereu a lordre demons Jacques trianvier, qu'il mat
payez l'argent ie vous priant de payer ma lettre avec tous lhonnour
17 ditto
necessarie quis que je suit
mons Jacquis basselourt
mons. Depuis que vous est partie dier la dernier fois, mons Dumont
est mort, et comme touts les fabriques estaint vacantes, il lestous
entre pris et cest laraison que ie me trouv a present extremement
presse pour de l'argent et oblige de vous charger avec incent et
in quante florins, & ce que iay faut hier en faveur de mons Jacque
trivier atrois jours devene vous priant treshamble ment de les paye
et de croire muss prendre song pric res compenser la faveire, quant
la avenir vous aurez desoing des autr chose Esperant delstre
poureveu de tous donspeudutemp, manque pourt d'faire bonpliyd
15 ditto
mons. mad. Dubekub
mad: Dupuis la mort Demons Dumont, jay commence maintenant touts
ces fabrig. en fin que ie pourrois estre en estat et vous rendre servce avecq touts
sans et draps, mais la maintenue dons: grande fabrique, me preste detours
coste pour d largent, ce qu'il mafaut prendre la liberte ditirer sur vous
Â£150:- en faneur de monsr. Jacques trivier en malets. dhier aa 3 jours
deven, vous priant dela satis faire prontement, ayant reccu la vallur
de luy ceque sespecd vous me preueras en mal parte car je ne perpas ault
In Antwerpen 14 Juny
Breda Laureys Ka
mons. hebbe ul brief van 11 deser ontfangen geirne gesien dat de 2 balen
wolle ware gearriveert ende dat de selve ul wel aenstaet, soo verwaght daer van
goet goet, oversulx doet ul devoir om mij te animeeren & soo ul tene
lakens claer sijn laelse in holant vollen, ende aen mij te komen omte
sien, hoedanige mij hebt te reguleeren waermede Blijve
14 Juny 1681
London George Cole
th
Sr. I have delayd to answer yd of 5 Aprill last, because I did not thinck, butt
that before now should have been in cash to remitt you soone mony en
actt. of JH butt trade beeng very low here & mony extreamly scarrey
keeps itt back whoever Ill be pressing for what is yett standing ott on that
accomps & remitt you as soone es possible, hopeing with next harvest to gett
in all in so much that with in 3 monthes hence all might the adviseed
to which I shall continew iny endeavour whilst I was in hopes you
should have minded the more mentioned Â£80: wherein I can serve
you freely command
14 June 1681
London Abram vivian
th
th
S. I wrott to you the 7: curitt what was need full, sence receceved yd of 27 pat
bij which I feare that non or few goods will come with these 2 vessels
now ready att Hull orperhaps departed, because, as yett you gve mee
no advise of any thingh beeng shipped which should cause no small preiudicce
butt I hope & exspect to understand better news, for wed ought not to be
served as least yeare: I take notice what you say of m. Holreiden
writing I am gladd you finde yd. self better served & though itt cost
some more troubles now, yett wee will finde the benefist of itte
when wee keeponely to one or 2 correspondents, which I'll be able to advise
you when Isee the goods now underway: I have examined the patt. of the bale
N. 34 which doth promise well, god send them butt safe over when you send med
the factory of the bayes you say itt will before about Â£600: and most
the other bales you y beeing finished will make you pay
Â£900: st which I do beleave will be there about, butt in case you please to
peruse my acctt you will not finde yd self in disbourse for my share: whoever
Iintend for Brussels next week, where I hope to receave a parcell of mony
when I'll remitt att short sight for yd acctt. on which you may depend, for I would
Rather keep not one farting in cast & be aremitting then to have bills
remning up on mee - inclosed is invoyce for a packett N. 154.22 p of lace
for which please to give mee creditt beeng Â£80:4:10 f. itt will come with
Ben: klerck as I supose he intending to saile very speedly I do not question, butt
that you will finde these to content & that you will advance well up on them
your measures for the broadest sort is so bro ad, that & can finde non or verry few
of that sige, so that I can not assort the packetts to my minde, whoever the
next will containe more broad laces, which I have ordered to be made to purpose: when
now you receave these laces, lett mee butt know which numbers prove good, or bad & then
I shall know how to governe my self, for I note up on my book eack peeces from
whom I have itt to my opinion are the N. 116: 118:119:121â€ž 122â€ž 123â€ž 124â€ž 125 of the
best hande now afford mee yd for these 8 st are of one hand & all the rest of
severall others a governo whilst I remaine with kinde saluts
London P. S. Receave ust yd of 30 passo the orders In Antw: 14 june 1681
you are given for 3 bales more are well as also, that you shall not delift in giving
mr. potter continuall icorrigement for his persisting in well doing, the pattarnes
for the bale N.35: are well, as also Ihether to receaved, hope the rest will prove
accordingly, god send all safe over, there were 5 bales att Hull lett our risi co bedorided
that is in each vessel Â½ of what comes to Hull & lett yd freind att leeds not over staste
them selves for what can not come biy these vessels, for when these you, they shall
have time enought to compleat our orders before any others ships ready I have
observed what you say about mony, I know that my orders for the whole will be
more then Â£9: a Â£1000: yett you must not pay itt all att a time where fore
hope to prevaill what with timely remisess butt as yett I hope itt isto contant
asseuring of ar other remisire the next week onwach you may depend as for laces
I'll desist with what is already bought & attworck whith in all will be about
Æ’
Â£300: flemish yd inclosed is delivered in the post house & so remaine tillnext
London sHenry maynard
14 June 1681
th
h
S my last to you was on the 11: curitt sence recd. yd of 30: past. by which take not iue
how our 4 bales N. 20 â€ž 22123 & 24 are shipt I hope the spanish resting cloathes may come
with the same because I doubt that no other vessel will part 100 soone yett whoever
to minde our intrest att yd side is best to you, as here I endeavour on this side as to the
6N. silver marck I hope you shall prevaile with the clothier for some peeels because
I have so fuit fully promised to deliver them & roosen dael here m. kent freind doth
bragy, as if ha had & onely could engeage the maker for him self yds 2 bills shall
besent for acceptance in closed one bill on John rearse for 5221 Crownes att 56Â¼
is Â£122:6:10 Â½ att 1 Â½ uso for my acctt. which I hope shall not in commode you becausee
this day could finde no billsatt short time, so pleased to procure the needfull: whilst
I shall endeavour to contin a remitting & remaiie
15 Juy
sent Francois Herrebout
mons. heden vertrckt van hier nae costij beurtschipp Jan lathonder, voor mij in hebben
R N 15 & 16. soo haest de selve ul terhant comen sult die cito opbrugge sende aende oA
Raphael Coots om mijne ordre te volgen in gesloten senden t wee wisset Â£100: t
totloste Ber: vandervinck & soo veel tot last lodonichis dewolf dew gelieft
bijde tte doen amgre oste bij foute van die te doen acrepteeren & aen mij tegen
dijnsdagh savangen herrewaerte te besorgen waer op mij verlate & blijve
